item.title: Deep pothole, 17th January
item.description:
Church Road, Leckhampton outside Beverston. I think this pothole is deeper than a tennis ball so I have reported it to the Emergency Number. I have entered in into this website so I can upload pictures showing the location and the state of the pothole.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Volunteer litter pick bags ready for collection, 17th January
item.description:
Next to the Innsworth Lane Sports Ground sign. The 'What 3 Words' location is ///examiner.slopes.courage The ordnance survey map reference is: 51.883919,-2.213313 Council Litter Bin Ref: 0254

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Innsworth Lane, Longlevens, Gloucester

item.category: Litter picking bags ready for collection

item.title: Very large pot hole on churchdown lane, 17th January
item.description:
This pothole has been repaired numerous times over the last couple years. Its outside the turning where 20 to 28 churchdown lane is. A car will get some damaged

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchdown Lane, Gloucester

item.title: Path totally blocked by overgrown vegetation, 17th January
item.description:
At what 3 words reward.slowly.lock GR SO950258 pathway is totally blocked. No way through, lacking signage etc. needs total remediation.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: It was dark so couldn't see the pothole on unlit road. Felt very deep though. Before railway bridge heading along Badgeworth road from Churchdown towards the Reddings, 17th January
item.description:
Before railway bridge on Badgeworth Rd heading from Churchdown. I had no idea it was there as it was dark. I do know there have been potholes along that stretch of road for months though.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road is starting to subside, 17th January
item.description:
Driving towards Woodmancote from Southam about a 3 metre stretch on the LH side just before the junction with Two Hedges Road. That side of the road, that has been repaired numerous times, has started to subside, tarmac has come loose and there are now various potholes
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Every time there is any rain , the road becomes blocked by surface water which has not drained away, 17th January
item.description:
Every time there is any rain , the road becomes blocked by surface water which has not drained away - all this problem needs is a small trench from the road side into the large drain by the hedge - not a big job - if you can’t do it - I can
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
